MITE0000001.reaction_description: AviG2 is responsible for methylation of the hydroxyl group at position 6 of the D-mannose moiety.

MITE0000002.reaction_description: O-methyltransferase and is responsible for methylation of the phenolic hydroxyl group in the dichloroisoeverninic acid moiety.

MITE0000003.reaction_description: AviG6 for methylation of the hydroxyl group at position 2 of the D-mannose moiety.

MITE0000004.reaction_description: methylation of the hydroxyl group at position 4 of the D-fucose moiety

MITE0000005.reaction_description: Iodination of orsellenic acid derivate, assumed to be bound to coenzyme A co-factor

MITE0000006.reaction_description: O-methylation of orsellenic acid, assumed to be bound to coenzyme A cofactor

MITE0000007.reaction_description: O-methylation of iodinated orsellenic acid derivate, assumed to be bound to 4'-phosphopantetheine co-factor

MITE0000008.reaction_description: Hydroxylation of iodinated orsellenic acid derivate, assumed to be bound to coenzyme A

MITE0000011.reaction_description: Catalyzes the O-methylation of demethylmycophenolic acid into mycophenolic acid

MITE0000014.reaction_description: 4-DPMC is the first stable intermediate of the mithramycin biosynthesis. This is converted into PMC by methylation at C-4-O through the MtmMI methyltransferase in Streptomyces argillaceus

MITE0000025.reaction_description: Introduces the first crosslink (biaryl ether) between hpg4 and bht6 of the balhimycin precursor.

MITE0000027.reaction_description: Installs a biaryl ether bond on the balhiycin precursor. The reaction might be less specific than depicted in the reaction SMARTS. There is no detailed study on the specificity so far. The reaction occurs probably while the precursor peptide backbone is bound to the NRPS as shown for the closely related vancomycin biosynthesis (10.1002/ANIE.200461278).

MITE0000028.reaction_description: The halogenase chlorinates the second bht residue of the balhimycin precursor, probably while the precursor is bound to module 6 of the NRPS. The PCP domain of module 6 might be required for the reaction. The substrate specificity of the enzyme might be less specific than represented in the SMARTS pattern. In order to make the specificity not too broad structures were rather kept in the pattern than left out.

MITE0000029.reaction_description: KtzQ is a regiospecific halogenase that catalyzes the chlorination of L-Trp at C7 position to yield 7-chlorotryptophan

MITE0000030.reaction_description: KtzR is a regiospecific halogenase that catalyzes chlorination at the 6-position of 7-Cl-L-Tryptophan to generate 6,7-diCl-L-Trp.

MITE0000032.reaction_description: Mediates the methylation of tyrosine into 3-methyl-L-tyrosine (3-Me-Tyr) in biosynthesis of saframycin A

MITE0000033.reaction_description: Adds N-acetylglucosamine or N-acylglucosamine to Hpg4 of the teicoplanin aglycone. Substrate specificity is probably more general than depicted in the reaction SMARTS, but there is no precise information on substrate specificity. In order to avoid making the reaction too general, the complete backbone is included in the pattern.

MITE0000034.reaction_description: Glycosyltransferase adds N-acetylglucosamine to Bht6 of the teicoplanin precursor. Substrate specificity is probably more general than depicted in the reaction SMARTS, but there is no precise information on substrate specificity. In order to avoid making the reaction too general, the complete backbone is included in the pattern.

MITE0000035.reaction_description: Deacetylates N-acetylglucosaminyl residue on Hpg4 of the teicoplanin precursor.

MITE0000036.reaction_description: Deacetylates N-acetylglucosaminyl residue on Hpg4 of the teicoplanin precursor.

MITE0000037.reaction_description: Transfers glucose onto hpg4 in the vancomycin and teicoplanin aglycone.

MITE0000038.reaction_description: Introduces the second biaryl-ether crosslink between bht2 and hpg4 in the vancomycin and balhimycin precursor. The reaction occurs while the vancomycin precursor is bound to the PCP of module 6 or 7. The enzyme only accepts the chlorinated precursor.

MITE0000039.reaction_description: Methylates the N-terminus of the vancomycin backbone. Substrate specificity not known in detail. SMARTS has been designed to be not too unspecific by accident. True substrate specificity might be broader than assumed here.

MITE0000040.reaction_description: Chlorinates bht 2 and bht 6 of vancomycin. The bond to the PCP domain of module 2 of the vancomycin NRPS might be important for the reaction. There is no study on the substrate specificity for the second chlorination reaction in vancomycin biosynthesis on bht 6 so far.

MITE0000041.reaction_description: Introduces the first biaryl-ether crosslink between hpg4 and bht6 in the vancomycin and balhimycin precursors. Reaction occurs while the backbone precursor is bound to the PCP domain of module 6 or 7. The link to the PCP domain is required for the reaction.

MITE0000042.reaction_description: Transfers vancosamine onto glucose on hpg4 of vancomycin pseudoaglycone.

MITE0000044.reaction_description: P450-catalyzed oxidative decarboxylation of terminal thiazoline of bottromycin precursor in Streptomyces sp. BC16019

MITE0000045.reaction_description: O-methylating SAM-dependent carboxyl methyltransferase from Streptomyces sp. BC16019 - Bottromycin precursor D-Asp O-methylation

MITE0000046.reaction_description: Bottromycin-precursor acting rSAM methyltransferase from Streptomyces sp BC16019;C-methylation of both Val4 and Val5 of bottromycin A2

MITE0000047.reaction_description: Bottromycin-precursor acting rSAM methyltransferase from Streptomyces sp. BC16019;C-methylation of Pro2 of bottromycin A2.

MITE0000048.reaction_description: Cleavage of N-terminal Met from a NH2-Met-Gly-Pro-Xn chain, exposing a N-terminal Gly; bottromycin biosynthesis in Streptomyces sp. BC16019.

MITE0000049.reaction_description: Catalysis of radical C-methylation of Phe6 of bottromycin-precursor after precursor Met cleavage.

MITE0000050.reaction_description: Cleaves modified bottromycin precursor peptide between thiazole8 and Met9.

MITE0000051.reaction_description: epimerization of L-Asp7 to D-Asp7 of modified bottromycin precursor peptide

MITE0000052.reaction_description: thiazole heterocyclisation of Cys8 of bottromycin-precursor

MITE0000053.reaction_description: macroamidine macrocyclization of Gly1 and Val4 of bottromycin-precursor

MITE0000054.reaction_description: Flavin-dependent tryptophan-5-halogenase catalyzed halogenation reaction of deschloro-microbisporicin A2

MITE0000055.reaction_description: Lassopeptide macrolactam formation after N-terminal cleavage: NH2-G-G-X-X-X-X-X-E-X-X-X-X-X-X-X-X-X-X-X-F-X-COOH.

MITE0000056.reaction_description: ATP-dependent N-terminal cleavage of leader peptide, resulting in immature intermediate core peptide.

MITE0000057.reaction_description: Catalyzes the flavin-dependent Baeyer-Villiger oxidation in the biosynthesis of pentalenolactone

MITE0000059.reaction_description: Catalyzes oxidative rearrangement of final step in pentalenolactone pathway

MITE0000060.reaction_description: Carboxylation of intermediate in pentalenolactone biosynthetic pathway

MITE0000064.reaction_description: Catalyzes oxidation of pentalen-13-al in the neopentalenolactone pathway

MITE0000065.reaction_description: Catalyzes the flavin-dependent Baeyer-Villiger oxidation in the biosynthesis of neopentalenolactone

MITE0000070.reaction_description: FAD-dependent enzyme RebC catalyse the oxidation of two carboxylic acids to form a maleimide ring. RebC cofactor is FAD.

MITE0000072.reaction_description: TdaE relies on its substrate as electron donor (rather than NAD(P)H) for O2 activation and covalent flavin-oxygen adduct formation. Then, TdaE incorporates both O2-derived oxygen atoms into the substrate most likely via transient FlN5OO and FlN5O species, thereby breaking the CoA thioester bond and epoxidizing the tropone ring.

MITE0000077.reaction_description: C-methylation of methylsalicylic acid bound to coenzyme A. Auxiliary enzyme MdpB2 needed to load methylsalicylic acid on coenzyme A.

MITE0000080.reaction_description: C-methylation of methylsalicylic acid bound to coenzyme A. Auxiliary enzyme PokM3 needed to load methylsalicylic acid on coenzyme A.

MITE0000082.organism: Actinoplanes missouriensis (strain ATCC 14538 / DSM 43046 / CBS 188.64 / JCM 3121 / NBRC 102363 / NCIMB 12654 / NRRL B-3342 / UNCC 431)

MITE0000083.organism: Actinoplanes missouriensis (strain ATCC 14538 / DSM 43046 / CBS 188.64 / JCM 3121 / NBRC 102363 / NCIMB 12654 / NRRL B-3342 / UNCC 431)

MITE0000091.reaction_description: CYP71BN1 catalyzes the two-step oxidation of lycosantalene to lycosantalonol

MITE0000151.reaction_description: catalyzes three-step oxidations at the C-4 methyl group to carboxylic acid to yield soppiline C

MITE0000158.reaction_description: PhoJ is a dioxygenase involved in a ring-opening strategy to form monodictyphenone as in intermediate in phomoxanthone A biosynthesis

MITE0000159.reaction_description: PhoD is a dehydratase responsible for the formation of the intermediate chrysophanol during biosynthesis of phomoxanthone A

MITE0000160.reaction_description: PhoD is a reductase responsible for the reduction of a double bond during biosynthesis of phomoxanthone A

MITE0000162.reaction_description: Responsible for the conversion of emodin anthrone to emodin by oxidation during biosynthesis of phomoxanthone A

MITE0000163.reaction_description: Decarboxylase responsible for the conversion of atrochrysone carboxylic acid to atrochrysone.

MITE0000164.reaction_description: PhoP is a short-chain dehydrogenases/reductase responsible for a reductive cyclisation step in the biosynthesis of phomoxanthone A

MITE0000167.reaction_description: Ring cleavage in the scope of detoxification.

MITE0000168.reaction_description: ProsA works in concert with SDR ProsC to yield the pathway intermediate. Order of reactions is not clear from experimental data. Overexpression of either ProsA or ProsC alone does not yield any product.

MITE0000169.reaction_description: ProsC works in concert with P450 ProsA to yield the pathway intermediate. Order of reactions is not clear from experimental data. Overexpression of either ProsA or ProsC alone does not yield any product.

MITE0000198.reaction_description: Chlorinates free-floating L-tryptophan exclusively in position 5

MITE0000214.reaction_description: Converts germacrene A to germacrene A acid via three-step oxidation

MITE0000219.reaction_description: Introduction of biaryl-bond between two ortho-tyrosine residues

MITE0000223.reaction_description: N-prenylation on guanidine moiety of arginine residue of Argicyclamide C

MITE0000224.reaction_description: Prenylation and Methyl esterification at free N- and C-termini of linear peptides

MITE0000225.reaction_description: Macrocyclisation of Tyr-phenol-O to Leu-C bond observed in arabipeptin A. A minimum leader sequence KDFESKPGS + follower sequence QG is required for enzymatic activity

MITE0000226.reaction_description: Glycosylation of stromemycin in Aspergillus ustus

MITE0000227.organism: Aspergillus flavus (strain ATCC 200026 / FGSC A1120 / IAM 13836 / NRRL 3357 / JCM 12722 / SRRC 167)
MITE0000227.reaction_description: Oxidative cyclization of Y2 and Y6 in the FYYTGY hexapeptide, no leader peptide required. The sequence KRFYYTGYKR did not lead to any products

MITE0000228.reaction_description: Transfers different Acyl-CoAs onto tyrosine; reaction shown for yunnansin B. N-terminal SFQEDT essential for enzymatic activity.

MITE0000229.reaction_description: Lasso macrocyclisation of gelatinamin intermediate after leader peptide cleavage.

MITE0000230.reaction_description: N-terminal cleavage of gelatinamin leader peptide, resulting in immature intermediate core peptide.

MITE0000231.reaction_description: Introduction of second macrocylce on lassopeptide via hydrolysis of C-terminal amino acid.

MITE0000232.reaction_description: Acetylation of single C-terminal lysin of gelatinamin B to prevent auto-toxicity.

MITE0000233.reaction_description: Dehydration of ser/thr in nisin A precursor peptide. Leader peptide with FNLD sequence ("box") essential for recognition.

MITE0000234.reaction_description: (Methyl-)lanthionine formation between dehydrated Ser/Thr and Cys on nisin precursor peptide modified by NisB.

MITE0000235.reaction_description: Cleavage of nisin precursor peptide (prepeptide) by recognizing the GASPR cleavage site. Presence of lantionine-rings is essential for cleavage in vivo, but not strictly necessary in vitro.

MITE0000236.organism: Streptantibioticus cattleyicolor (strain ATCC 35852 / DSM 46488 / JCM 4925 / NBRC 14057 / NRRL 8057)
MITE0000236.reaction_description: Hydroxylates intermediate in beta-ethynylserine pathway, showing high substrate-specificity.

MITE0000237.reaction_description: Reductive cyclization to form a 6-membered ring in pactamide pathway.

MITE0000238.reaction_description: Reductive cyclization to form a 5-membered ring.

MITE0000239.reaction_description: Reductive cyclization to form a 5-membered ring in ikarugamycin pathway.

MITE0000240.reaction_description: Reductive cyclization to form a 6-membered ring.

MITE0000241.reaction_description: Forward O-prenylation of threonine residue of precursor peptide to yield tolypamide in Tolypothrix sp. PCC 7601

MITE0000242.reaction_description: Hydroxylation of tirandamycin C as first tailoring step in the tirandamycin pathway. TamI oxygenation requires a specific sequence of oxygenations, showing high substrate specificity.

MITE0000243.reaction_description: TamL oxidizes the C-10 hydroxy to a keton in the tirandamycin biosynthetic pathway. High substrate specificity.

MITE0000244.reaction_description: Reverse prenylation of brevianamide F in the notoamid pathway, with high substrate specificity (no products for other diketopiperazides).

MITE0000245.reaction_description: Hydroxylation of deoxybrevianamide E in notoamide biosynthetic pathway.

MITE0000246.reaction_description: Aromatic prenylation of tryptophan-moiety of 6-OH deoxybrevianamide E in the notoamide D pathway. Enzyme shows high substrate specificity.

MITE0000247.reaction_description: Oxidative cyclisation of the notoamide E oxidase in the notoamide pathway, leading to notoamide C. NotB shows high substrate specificity.

MITE0000248.organism: Penicillium rubens (strain ATCC 28089 / DSM 1075 / NRRL 1951 / Wisconsin 54-1255)
MITE0000248.reaction_description: Transacylation of side chain of isopenicillin N in the biosynthetic pathway of penicillin G.

MITE0000249.reaction_description: Cyclization of the ACV substrate to isopenicillin N in the biosynthetic pathway of beta-lactam antibiotics

MITE0000250.reaction_description: Macrocyclization of DynB precursor peptide. Available information indicates that full leader peptide is required for substrate recognition.

MITE0000251.reaction_description: Biaryl formation between Trp-C5 and Trp-N1 at the WxW motif; enzyme has promiscuous substrate specificity.

MITE0000252.reaction_description: NosB hydroxylates the gamma-position of Glu6 in the nosiheptide biosynthetic pathway.

MITE0000253.reaction_description: NosA cleaves C-alpha-N bond of terminal enamine in nosiheptide maturation. Presence of hydroxylated pyridin is essential for substrate recognition.

MITE0000254.reaction_description: Hydroxylates the pyridin moiety of the nascent nosiheptide intermediate

MITE0000255.reaction_description: Introduction of 23-membered main macrocyclic ring system in nosiheptide via a formal [4+2] cycloaddition reaction, with removal of leader peptide.

MITE0000256.reaction_description: Completion of 19-membered side ring system in nascent nosiheptide by C1 unit introduction and conjugation with Glu.

MITE0000257.reaction_description: Dehydratation of Ser/Thr residues to Dha/Dhb in the biosynthetic pathway of nosiheptide, after NosIJK-catalyzed addition of MIA. Current knowledge indicates that the full leader peptide is required for substrate recognition.

MITE0000258.reaction_description: Attaches 3-methyl-2-indolic acid (MIA) via through S-MIAylation to Cys8 in the nosiheptin biosynthetic pathway. Current knowledge indicates that the full leader peptide is required for substrate recognition.

MITE0000259.reaction_description: Dehydrogenation of thiazolines to thiazoles in nosiheptide pathway. Current data indicates that full leader peptide is required for substrate recognition.

MITE0000260.reaction_description: Cyclodehydration of cystein-thiol with preceding peptide bond

MITE0000261.reaction_description: 3-methyl-2-indolic acid (MIA) synthase involved in nosiheptide biosynthesis
